Field Detail

environment

public sim.field.continuous.Continuous3D environment
An environment the agents are moving in. This object has to be created in an early stage because it will referenced during the creation of agents because on creation agents will update their location. The locations are stored in the environment object.

init

void init()

updateLocation

public void updateLocation(IVisualAgent agent)
This is a basic glue method demanded by the IAgentLocator interface. This method allows every agent to inform the simulation about a change in the agents location.

Parameters:
agent - The agent whose location has to be updated.

The visualization object.

getObjectsWithinDistance

public java.lang.Object[] getObjectsWithinDistance(IMovingAgent agent,
                                                   double distance)
Compute every agent that is within a certain location from an agent. This method assumes all objects are points so only the objects. Due to the algorithm provided by MASON objects with a distance at least as provided are included.
Because MASON stores the visual objects in the environment the simulation agents have to be retrieved first before the array is returned.

Specified by:
getObjectsWithinDistance in class ForagingHoneyBeeSimulation
Parameters:
agent - The agent where to start.
distance - The distance (radius) the returned agents should lie within.
Returns:
All objects that are at least in the distance.
